results.title: Cyberthon V: Spectrum 4 - Green
results.creator_credit: G-O-D/ G=enerator, O=perator, D=estroyer and Adem Jaffers
results.brief_description:
Cyberthon V: Spectrum 4 – Green was broadcast as the fourth of eight in an episodic series on Channel 31 in Melbourne. This format allowed for the creation of tighter, curated segments for broadcast instead of the impromptu, marathon-like events of the previous Cyberthons.

As well as electronic music, art, remixed footage (from previous Cyberthon events), guerrilla style music videos, drug and rave safe promotions, experimental performances and short films, global participation was also encouraged via online production meetings. As Cyberthon curator Adem Jaffers said “Cyberthon had become a public TV ‘Access Show’ nested within a public TV ‘Access Channel’ [which was] quite unique really!”

A selection of artists: Tekno Mandala (Adem Jaffers), Garry Gallagher (Xmix), Rave Safe, Troubled Waters, Rave Safe Info (Melissa Dent & Michael Arnold), Mad Club (Danny Slim, Susan Clinch, Bernie Grogan & Matt the Tree), Surfis (Dom Owen and Peter Bourke), and The Visitor (Andrew Till).

Cyberthon V: Spectrum 4 – Green is part of the Cyberthon Archive generously donated to ACMI by Adem Jaffers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: G-O-D/ G=enerator, O=perator, D=estroyer and Adem Jaffers
results.description:
Please note, this video may potentially trigger seizures for people with photosensitive epilepsy. Viewer discretion is advised.

Cyberthon V: Spectrum 4 – Green was broadcast as the fourth of eight in an episodic series on Channel 31 in Melbourne. This format allowed for the creation of tighter, curated segments for broadcast instead of the impromptu, marathon-like events of the previous Cyberthons.

As well as electronic music, art, remixed footage (from previous Cyberthon events), guerrilla style music videos, drug and rave safe promotions, experimental performances and short films, global participation was also encouraged via online production meetings. As Cyberthon curator Adem Jaffers said “Cyberthon had become a public TV ‘Access Show’ nested within a public TV ‘Access Channel’ [which was] quite unique really!”

Cyberthon V: Spectrum 4 – Green is part of the Cyberthon Archive generously donated to ACMI by Adem Jaffers.

CREDITS:

Director - G.O.D./ G=enerator, O=perator, D=estroyer

Graphics Operator - Dan Flett

TV Technicians with RMIT CSG - Steve Howard, J. Krejcik
DJ - Digital Primate (Chris Coe)
Camera - E. Fitzsimmons, D. McLauclan, Frank Peppard
Lighting - Voodoo (Phil Woodman)
Audio and Lights Supplier - LAVA
Props - Voodoo (Phil Woodman), Sioux Dollman
Floor - Kirsten Vinck

PRODUCTION CREW
Producer - Adem Jaffers
Live Producer - Frank Peppard
Web Design - Gary Gallagher, RMIT Computer Centre
Sponsorship - Catherine Carr
Publicity - Sunny Grace
Factbook Design - Melanie Carr
Neolithic Animation - Mandala (Adem Jaffers)
Neolithic Music - Third Eye, The Spiritualist, Void

CONTRIBUTORS
22:34:00hrs
=XMIX=
Animation - Tekhead
Audio - cal-q-lator, “dr. bradford”

22:35:35hrs
“rave-safe”
hosts, graphics - Melissa Dent, Michael Arnold
guest - Cat from MINE

22:41:15hrs
“mad club”
+ friends

22:44:15hrs
“troubled waters”
Greenpeace

22:48:50hrs
“surf - is”
Camera, Editing - doom-boy
Animation - mandala
Water Camera - P. Bourke
DJ - The Visitor
Thanks to SW

23:05:25hrs
“RRRealtime”
VJ - Mandala, Future, Messenger
DJ - The Visitor

results.title: Cyberthon IV: EPIC Omnicast (Psymmetry in Psyburbia)
results.brief_description:
Cyberthon-IV: EPIC Omnicast (Psymmetry in Psyburbia) was the fourth Cyberthon broadcast event in the Cyberthon series held during the Experimenta festival in 1994. Like the Cyberthon events before it, Cyberthon-IV: EPIC Omnicast was a collaborative, live broadcast featuring artists, performers, DV’s and VJ’s.

This event more than any other Cyberthon broadcast, employed a range of cutting-edge technologies to broaden its reach. Global participation was fostered via emergent online platforms such as a bulletin board system (BBS), C.U-SeeMe videoconferencing and a multicast backbone (M-Bone) or virtual network. In a Melbourne, if not world first, use of these platforms allowed artists to connect and create with their audience while enthusiasm for experimental electronic music and art saw DV’s and VJ’s mixing audio and images simultaneously while also taking audience requests.

Visual Artists: Tekno Mandala (Adem Jaffers), Cyber Dada (Dale Nason and Troy Innocent), Don’t Shoot the Messenger (Steve Middleton and Attillio Gangemi)

Audio Artists: Voodoo Moon (Ollie Olsen and Arthur Arkin), Zen Paradox (Steve Law), Mystic Force (Russel Hancorne), Psyko Disko (Fred Disco), The Visitor (Andrew Till)

Performers: 3RRR radio host on Tranzmission (Kate Bathgate).

Cyberthon IV: EPIC Omnicast is part of the Cyberthon Archive generously donated to ACMI by Adem Jaffers.

results.title: Only Sound Remains
results.creator_credit: Arash Ashtiani, Aliocha Allard, Pierre-Alain Giraud, Anshu Poddar and London Film School
results.brief_description: In the wake of the violent post-election protests in Iran, a man and his wife, Babak and Nahid, try to hide the devastating news from Babak’s grandmother that his brother is missing.

results.title: One Week Later
results.creator_credit: Peter Snelling, Rachel Tunnard, Mandy Rathbone, Ferndown Upper School, First Light and PVA Medialab
results.brief_description: Told through the eyes of a younger pupil, who surveys the relationships his brother has with his peer group. As revelations and misunderstandings occur, due to the misuse of the ubiquitous mobile phone, the week’s events come to a climax on a Friday afternoon.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Snelling, Rachel Tunnard, Mandy Rathbone, Ferndown Upper School, First Light and PVA Medialab

results.title: Prehistoric Pet Shop
results.creator_credit: Chris Barnard, Mathew Buck, George Ing, Create Studios, Dacoit Studios, Evil Twin Artworks and First Light
results.brief_description: Prehistoric Pet Shop is about a caveman whose alarm clock stops working. But not just any alarm clock - the clock was a bird with an unfortunate heart problem. The caveman goes to the pet shop to complain about his faulty alarm clock. A homage to Monty Python’s parrot sketch, this hilarious short reveals that complaining can get you more than just a new alarm clock.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chris Barnard, Mathew Buck, George Ing, Create Studios, Dacoit Studios, Evil Twin Artworks and First Light

results.title: Until My Heart's, Like, Finished
results.creator_credit: Peter Snelling, Martin Hodgson, Phil Shepherd, First Light and Somerset Film
results.brief_description: On the day of your 16th birthday, your mum kicks you out of home for good. You live in a car. You sofa surf. You sleep rough. Life for these young people has been tough with many challenges. Here they tell their stories in their own words, reveal they have learnt about how to survive and make plans for putting their lives back together.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Snelling, Martin Hodgson, Phil Shepherd, First Light and Somerset Film

results.title: Pirates of the Indian Ocean
results.creator_credit: Enamul Khan, Omni Rahman, Rafi Rahman, First Light, Northamptonshire Bangladeshi Association and Wind & Foster Media
results.brief_description: Clumsy but lovable DJ duo Mankind and Small-Steps have built a devoted following to their pirate radio show. Raging against the machine in their own inimitable style, will they reach the top of radio programming or be caught on the wrong side of the law before they reach their dream?

results.title: The Box
results.creator_credit: Felix Drake, Patrick Young, Phoebe Flemming, eShed, First Light and Watershed
results.brief_description: This short drama is a tight observation of family life during the recession. Shot in a single living room, we see the ebb and flow of family life reflected in some pivotal moments through a particularly difficult time. However, the digital hearth remains a constant source of comfort.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Felix Drake, Patrick Young, Phoebe Flemming, eShed, First Light and Watershed

results.title: All4One [game trailer]
results.creator_credit: Brodue Hamilton, Damien Hamilton and Kaiden Hamilton
results.brief_description:
3D car racing game where cooperation is the key!

Under the category ‘Secondary Videogames’, Brodie, Kaiden and Damien Hamilton from Mount Waverly, Victoria, were the Screen It 2012 winners.
